website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty power cage that offers variety by itself and can also welcome more accessories.
pros: Maximum weight capacity of 1,000 pounds gives all lifters plenty of room for improvement
Includes two safety bars, dip bars, and four J-hooks
cons: Lat pull-down bar and cable can be incorporated but must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July and it broke 40 days later. It literally fell apart while I was lifting on it and haven't done anything outside of its weight limit. The construction on the bottom is weak and bent, almost severely injuring me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Tuosto

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The holes are off so we are unable to use the catch bar. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing controls
customer_reviews.text: One yellow pole had misaligned holes (one side off by 1 cm) on 12 of 16 holes, such that J-hooks or safety bars could not be inserted into any holes above the 4th. This is mentioned in several reviews, so I assume it's due to poor manufacturing controls. Also, one of the brackets of another pole was bent inwards, as mentioned in many reviews, making it difficult to insert into the overhangs. I am returning this product. Note: Seller offers ~$30 worth in incentives (free J-hooks) for leaving good reviews. Keep in mind when reading reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Quality control and customer service are nonexistent. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: All four of the vertical posts were bent at one end to the point that I couldn't assemble the cage. I emailed the company and they never responded. Absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: christinabot

customer_reviews.title: Parts wearing out after few weeks
customer_reviews.text: The plastic wheel is cracking only after several weeks of use, which makes the entire tower shake and added resistance to the pulley... Pros: the tower is very easy to assemble and at a good price point if this part wasn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Paint of rust, Have to bend to assemble, Not as strong as expected
customer_reviews.text: So when the product came, the paint was chipped and I saw it was literally brown and rusted under the paint. I later found every metal piece was basically rusted from china and than painted over. Welds are REALLLLLLLY BAD... Also, a lot of black dust was coming out of the poles which I didnt really know what it was. Assembling it was pretty hard. You literally have to hammer it in or bend it a little to make it fit. I really recommend not buying it but you guys can and will probably know what I am talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Jan T

customer_reviews.title: Packaging Issues
customer_reviews.text: I won’t be able to assemble this because they sent two of the same bottom pieces. The assembly bars won’t connect because of this. It’s currently out of stock of course so I’m wondering if I should just get a welder to take the connections off and re-weld them so I can actually use this. The package had been wrapped in plastic and previously opened so someone in the packaging department had messed up. I’m pretty irritated about this considering these things are hard to come by these days. The instructions are not very helpful but useless as I can’t even connect the pieces together at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Ct. Wizolsellon

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack
customer_reviews.text: My son and I built this rack in about 90 minutes. It was simple to put together. I would recommend that you use a rubber mallet to facilitate the assembly. The rack is 1,000-lb rated and is sturdy. The pullup bars at the top are a bonus. I would buy this product again in a heart beat. The delivery was quick and without issues. Manko delivery was great. The delivery drivers wore gloves and masks. You won't find a better rack 1,000-lb rated rack than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is for the cable crossover attachment. Works well for the price. I was shorted a rolled. There are four on each side. The manufacturer did send another one but took a month to get here. The instructions are just 4 pictures. It would have been nice to either have more picture of the installation process or some written instructions. I was able to figure it out but took some doing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best Cage for the price! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This cage is amazing for the price point. Yes it’s from China, but it honestly feels very sturdy and well built. The welds all looked clean and very solid. The instructions to install it were vague, but still very easy and simple to install (took me personally about two hours to assemble). I did buy some of the attachments as well, and I couldn’t be happier having a full set up for the price I paid. I don’t see the reason paying several times more for a product name, when this does the same things as the other more expensive options. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: First Day Review
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about everyone else's experiences putting anything together, but this was relatively easy with only the 2 small wrenches they provided in the packaging. There was one bolt hole that wouldn't 100% completely align, but it was more like 98% aligned and all it took was a swift swing from a hammer to push it through - no big deal. The catch bars aligned, all the attachments fit sturdy and I'm happy I bought it. I'll update my review in a month or so after some heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: HealthyMexican

customer_reviews.title: Shakes like an exotic dancer. Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: So, three stars for ease of return. One star for cage. First time I put real weight, I didn’t feel safe. It’ll shift on pull ups and dips and I’m not a huge guy. When equipment is designed to save your life from being crushed...I learned not to cheap out. Returned and spent the extra couple hundred on a name brand from a trusted leader. Feel safe under several hundred pounds now. Company offers free J hooks for positive reviews so...keep that in mind. Wasn’t worth it to me. Go cheap somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: FoulHook

customer_reviews.title: Ignored Warranty Email
customer_reviews.text: This product came bent. Unfortunately, this made it very difficult to assemble, as the pictured piece couldn't fit over the piece it was supposed to. The product came with a warranty, but when i contacted the email address they never responded. Eventually I decided to try and bend it back into position, which worked ok, but seems a bit sketchy. Otherwise, it's decent for the price, although it feels a lot more flimsy than other squat cages. Wiggles slightly from side-to-side, but that hasn't been a big issue. If they had responded to the warranty email I would bump it up to a three or four star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer defective, split metal
customer_reviews.text: After opening package I noticed there was a crack in the metal on one of top arms, on one of the bends. After closer inspection I could tell in did not come from the delivery process, it was thinned metal from when the metal was originally bent, which caused it to split, rather than cracking. I will contact costumer support in hope of getting just an arm replacement, if all goes well I will update my star rating. If they say I must send back the whole thing, then I will keep existing rating.
customer_reviews.author: Monito

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this item.
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this item. Note that you have to pull the vertical bar down for the lat pull down accessory while tightening the screw at the top, ensuring that the plastic wheels that allow the weights to go up and down the bar, aren't making contact while under load. At first I felt resistance and it wasnt smooth. I took a look from above while having someone do some lat pulls and saw the issue. After adjusting this, worked great. Everything stayed in place and worked smoothly. Company sent out a free set of J-hooks before I even posted review. I hope they get the cable crossover back in stock so I can add more functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Middleman Sales and Auctions

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this power rack with lat attachment. The lat attachment was received 2 days before the cage arrived. The installation was a 2 person job. The directions could have been better. I suggest watch the video on the Amazon product page. It will make the installation way easier. Once together it looked good and was very sturdy. First thing I did was test it out by doing some pullups and it felt strong. Since I have worked out on it twice and totally enjoy this product. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a power rack with lat attachment. It is a great product especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Columbus Chic

customer_reviews.title: Defective part prevents proper assembly.
customer_reviews.text: The pullup bar assembly was incorrectly built so the bolt holes do not match up with those on the frame. Unable to correctly attach the pullup bar to the frame. All other parts were in good shape with no damage from shipping. Assembly was very easy. We will see how the warranty replacement works. 1/3/2020 Received response from Hulkfit that they no longer carry the item and do not have any spare parts.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Amazon please help!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon, please reach out to me! I received my cage without dips bars, without J hooks and without hardware! I reached out to HulkFit but they are out of stock for the dips bars. Please contact me to send me the dip bars. Alfredo.e.bocanegra@gmail.com When it comes to the cage it’s awesome! Took way longer than it should have because the u bracket was bent. But the cage itself once setups is great. They say you get what you pay for. We paid little and got a great set but with a lot of headaches along the way. I’d still recommend this cage to anyone though.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Bocanegra

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Received the power cage today. It was packaged well. I was a bit unnerved, because the directions just had 4 pictures and no words. However, all of the bolts and nuts are the same, so it assembled very easily. The cage seems study. The j-hooks and safety bars fit easily. The only complaint that I have is that the holes appear to be non-standard based on the other reviews. It would be nice if they were standard, so you can use any brand. Pros: Sturdy Solid value for the money Easy assembly Packaged well Cons: Non-standard fittings
customer_reviews.author: Kirk L

customer_reviews.title: A very versatile piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is super adjustable and is perfect for both me and my husband to use. We love the adjustability because I am under 5'7" and he is over 6' tall. We were a little apprehensive about ordering this without seeing it, but once it arrived we knew we had made a good purchase. We bought the rack with the added lat pull down attachment. This allows us to have a more complete workout without going to the gym. Assembly took us about 1.5 hours and was fairly straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: KansasMom

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Biggest disappointment ever waited 3 months and it was delayed another 2 weeks. Finally received it all the bolts where missing it’s built extremely out of square, the arms are not level they run about 1” down the uprights are twisted which makes the pulleys rub funny. Can’t find a way to contact seller. Highly aggravated with this poor quality junk!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley fielding

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Please Fix My Issue
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to be one of the lucky ones, but heck no I wasn’t. First, two of the ends on the yellow beams were bent badly. Had to use a prybar to bend them back, and still had a difficult time putting on the 2 lower beams. Second, the safety bar does not line up at all, which is now useless. I hope the company supplies some sort of a replacement to fix the misaligned safety bar issue. I will not update my review, until the safety bar issue is fixed. I didn’t spend $556 for something that I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I see reviews where people say was hard to put together. It was very easy. Yes some screw holes are a little snug but you just have to line everything up and goes right in. Very solid build. Only issue is if you get the base unit only and no attachments it is sturdy to do squats, dips and pullups etc. But if you hook a TRX up to it where you are going to putting angled leverage just put a weight bar with some weights on back side of it to weigh it down a bit and perfect. Great produt. Actually does not take up too much room. Cannot wait to add the cable lat pull down attachment.
customer_reviews.author: james wood

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend lat attachment.
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT recommend the lat attachment! Hard plastic rollers that raise the weight up/down shattered. Contacted company to notify & purchase new ones since I've owned a few months. They replied to my email to "look" for the part..week goes by and I email again....nope, they don't have a way to sell any replacement pieces. Basically leaving me with a useless piece of equipment that isn't even 1yr old!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Power cage!
customer_reviews.text: Compare to similar products, HulkFit power cage is so much cheaper. Quality of this power cage is really good. There are few paint nicks on the frames but it is barely visible and I really don't care...I will get lot of chips while doing weight lifting anyways. Here is a tip for hanging leg raise- You have to add some weights on the power cage (install J hooks on the rear frames' lowest holes and place barbell with weights) or it might fall while you swing your legs. Other than that, the cage is very sturdy, I have no issues with bench pressing, squats and pull ups with weights.
customer_reviews.author: moshi2

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a super cheap rack. Most commercial racks go for 2-5 thousand USD. That being said, this rack performs good considering the cheapness. Yes, the paint chips, Yes, you may have issues with the catch bars fitting (be sure to install them BEFORE tightening the rack crossbars). My catch bars will not move once installed due to the lack of squareness. There is some wobble to the rack if you don't bolt it to the floor, but I've squatted 500+ lbs and I personally didn't have an issue. I wouldn't attempt a 1000 lb anything in this rack, but it's good enough for 99.9 percent of people.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: First off I do not believe many of the reviews with pictures of the flaws of this cage are even a hulkfit cage? I’ve been lifting for over 20 years and for the money this thing works perfectly fine for maintenance lifting. However if you are power lifting or lifting very heavy weights I would recommend something more heavy duty. The attachments make this even better. The problem with this is it’s size in shipping. It may come a little dinged up etc but get a wooden or rubber mallet when you’re putting it together and you’ll have no problems at all. Overall this thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: J.P

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this power cage for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a power cage since my current setup was wobbly with the weight i was doing in squats which isn't a lot, 205lb. I have researched different models under 500 and finally decided to pull the trigger on the hulkfit power cage. The set up was straight forward and it took me about an hour by myself, I did have to use a ladder to attach the top bars. It seems very sturdy and its rated at 1,000 lbs which is more than enough for my needs. If you're on the fence about this cage I would go ahead and pull the trigger its great and its a once in a lifetime purchase!
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL SERRANO

customer_reviews.title: It was great!!! Until I realized I didn’t have any hardware for assembly
customer_reviews.text: Well...I’m sure this will be a great cage after I get to a hardware store and buy everything that I need to put it together. There was not a single nut or bolt with this unit. It was packed well and not beat up. I was so impressed until the 4th time of going through the packing looking for the hardware! I thought that with such nice packaging, surely I just missed the hardware somewhere...but much to my disappointment, no luck. Even my hulk fit bench came with hardware. Oh well, it could be worse I guess and the cage looks like it will be great once I can assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reverse pull-up bar for low ceilings
customer_reviews.text: I need to bulk up for the upcoming political revolution. Rack is very good bang for the buck . A soft mallet hammer helps with the malleable post brackets that may get slightly bent on the way from China, packaging is suboptimal for overseas origin. Overall it takes less than an hour to build and feels very solid. We have a low ceiling at 8 ft, so I hacked the pull up bar by reversing it 180 degrees. Now I don't eat insulation while working out. Would have liked to see 2 more hooks included or some weight holders. Would buy again. Wait for the price drops that appear periodically. Snagged mine under $400.
customer_reviews.author: Robodoc

customer_reviews.title: A solid power cage
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid power cage which is more than sufficient for home use. If you have the right tool-a ratchet, the assembly shouldn’t take more than 40 minutes. The instruction sheet didn’t give detailed instruction on assembling the cage. I found out there were 4 bolts a bit shorter than the other bolts (see the first picture). I used these short bolts for the bottom front of the cage (see the second picture). They are the only places where fewer parts are needed to be put together with the bolts. Hopefully it will save you some time during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cage For The Money
customer_reviews.text: Just received my cage and set it up yesterday evening. Assembly was quick and easy after clearing the upright holes of powder coating. A few strokes with a round file did the trick. From there it went together without incident and took about 35 minutes alone and not in a rush. I used a cordless impact to tighten the nuts and then checked them with a set of 17mm end wrenches. The safety bars fit and slide easily. Two things would make this home gym cage better: longer j-hooks and more depth between the uprights front to back. Overall I'm quite pleased. This thing will help me get by until the gym reopens. Stay Safe.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Flaws & all beware
customer_reviews.text: Holes for all 4 uprights don’t align....due to cheap packaging pieces come bent, scratched & rusted...all attachments are always on back order & hard to purchase...good luck on getting those once u receive your cage! Safety bars important pieces don’t align cause the holes on the cage are off.....be ready to make modifications which renders you cage in-sellable after...all they had to do was make sure everything works before putting this thing on the market down to the packaging and this would be a bang for your buck product
customer_reviews.author: Rick Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy to get setup
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our boys and it was an easy assembly. Have a lot of good features included, pull-up bar, dip bars, one pair of J-Hooks, plus the safety catch bars have J-Hooks as well. 3" hole spread works just fine for the pre-teen, teen, and myself for adjustments. It does have wobble to it but can stand up to a heavy load and use so far. Look forward to getting additional attachments for it as its a really good addition to the home gym for these kids given COVID restrictions for organized sports right now.
customer_reviews.author: SSNelson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Power Rack!
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time and settled on this one for my garage gym. Packaging was amazing, not a scratch on it. Delivery was less than two days time (impressive for 160lb package). Assembly was super easy with only one bolt size. I hand tightened everything until the whole thing was together and lined up before turning with the socket wrench. Lat pull down is actually really nice and a perfect addition. I'm a Marine and the biggest concern for me was if this would be sturdy enough for a lot of pull ups without concrete bolts or sand bags. It works perfectly and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were needed
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I researched power racks and cable crossovers for several months before deciding on the Hulkfit products. We liked that I had a higher weight capacity, comes with the dip bars, safety bars, and J-hooks, and has a smaller footprint so it fit in our home gym nicely. It put together easily and is sturdy. It's by no means a commercial grade piece of equipment, but it's perfect for our in home gym with just the two of us using it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value!
customer_reviews.text: Our HulkFit Power Cage, Rack & Stand arrived this week, right on time. Very well packaged for shipping. Assembly was easy! All the nuts and bolts were the same size, so each fit any place during assembly. Even included a package of extra nuts and bolts - marked extras! The various positions on the pull up bar are a bonus and the grip finish is good on both the pull up bars and the dip bars. The spotter bar and the J-hooks are solid and lock into place nicely. Anxious to start work-outs myself as are my two 20-something sons!
customer_reviews.author: Cougar Gold

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: One of the uprights was severely bent and created multiple issues with assembly including the misalignment of the holes for the safety bars. As a result one of the safety bars does not insert cleanly on the bottom 5 holes. The safety bars were installed before tightening bolts as directed but the holes are improperly machined or the upright is crooked either way it is disappointing to not have the cage function as it should right out of the box. Otherwise it seems sturdy and would otherwise be nice, appears to be a roll of the dice to see if you get a rack that is without defect.
customer_reviews.author: Cranjus Dingleberry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Honestly for the low price I wasn't expecting much. I just needed a squat rack that lasted through the quarantine. My expectations were far exceeded and the unit was well built and very decent quality. I've already had over 500 lbs on it and it handles it just fine. I wish I would have ordered the optional lat pull down attached as well. For the money it's hard to beat and performs on par with units that cost twice as much. Make sure you have the unit on a level ground before tightening the bolts all the way
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Lithgow

customer_reviews.title: Solid Power Rack, missing hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said the box the rack came in was beat up. Everything was fine, the power rack is solid. You can really slam some weight around on it and it will barely move. I love the pull up and dip attachments as well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it only came with 3 nuts for all the bolts. And they were scattered all over in the box. So I'm assuming they somehow came out at some point. Wasn't a huge deal, just had to go to Lowe's and buy some more. Other then that I would definitely recommend this power rack!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Sporer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm overall impressed with this power cage. It took around 1hr for me to assemble alone. If I had a the right socket, it would've taken about 30 minutes. They provided the proper wrenches to secure the bolts. The safety bars looked thin from the pictures and I was concerned about how much weight it could handle. They are actually quite heavy and thick in person. The entire cage feels very durable. I appreciate the extra nuts and bolts they provided. I highly suggest this power cage. I had my eyes set on one that was priced at $800. This one fit the bill for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric O.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, with a couple drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Power cage is decent quality for the price point. It does what it needs and easy to assemble. There’s definitely some shake and wobble under weight but it still manages to feel sturdy. Like other reviewers, one of the safety bars stopped moving freely once I tightened all the bolts down which is really annoying, so make sure you put them at the height you want to use them most during assembly just in case. I emailed customer service to ask if there was a trick to it but got no response, so minus one for customer service. Otherwise I’m pretty satisfied. Will probably go to a higher price point for my next one though.
customer_reviews.author: DDR

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with bolts, but only 2 nuts. Unable to assemble because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Alley

customer_reviews.title: Great for my garage gym!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on Prime Day. Such a great deal! It arrived two days later and I was able to assemble it by myself within an hour. The package is heavy so I cleared out space in my garage and moved it piece by piece from where it was delivered on my front porch. I tested it out by doing pull-ups and the rack didn't move or wobble at all. I feel very confident in the sturdiness of this rack. Love the bright color as well! No more waiting around at the gym to use a rack. I can walk 20 ft into my garage.
customer_reviews.author: WeightsAreForGirls

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functional, but there are quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I chose this model because I had to downsize my workout area (and expectations), and was looking for a small footprint and good value. Based on the reviews, this product seemed like the best value. The build quality is not good. The yellow uprights were bent in places and the holes don't line up on on the left side, making it difficult to push the spotter bar through. The metal also seems soft and thin compared to my old Body-Solid and Powertec cages.
customer_reviews.author: Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Piece if junk!! The cage and pulley arrived in damaged boxes. The cage contained NO bolts to put it together. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Ehh... just good enough for now.
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé and I bought this bench a few months ago. It’s stood up to his heavy lifting (and my not so heavy lifting) but it just feels cheap. Whenever I watch him using the bench I worry about the back rest breaking. Another issue is how lightweight it is. It’s nice because it’s easy to move but it moves when you don’t want it to, like mid lift! It’ll work for now but we’re definitely in the market for a more sturdy/durable bench. Possibly something closer to gym grade.
customer_reviews.author: Hollyann Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good cage
customer_reviews.text: Very well built for the price. The package was VERY banged up on arrival and one of the support beams was twisted, which likely occurred during shipping. After contacting the company they sent out a replacement beam ASAP. They were excellent to work with. I've given it some time in use and it's holding up well. The pull up bars are a nice addition, as well as the dip bars. Have not used it with any particularly heavy weights but am confident that it will do fine. Great buy for the money, especially when compared to others at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: ap

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This Item is flimsy and arrived missing parts. Overall, not a good purchase at all. Seller is hard to deal with
customer_reviews.author: Joe Home Owner

customer_reviews.title: Just What We Wanted
customer_reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised at how easily this cage came together (despite the lack of clear instructions. The instructions were terse and needed more explanatory text.) The cage seems strong and it fits perfectly in our spare bedroom, which has a normal 8' ceiling. We may buy a couple more of the clips that hole the pole in place so that we don't have to switch the clips when we move the height of the bar. Otherwise it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MoneyMom

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised
customer_reviews.text: This rack, although not as stout as what you'd find in commercial gyms, is more than adequate for home use. Great price, too! It was shipped on time and in good packaging. Had zero issues assembling, which required two people but only took about 20 minutes. I'm 6' tall. This is plenty tall for me, but short enough for my garage door to clear, which is nice. Still waiting on the lat pulldown attachment, which I'm excited for. One thing to note - this is not a 2 inch by 2 inch unit. It's closer to 2.25" x 2.25". So, a lot of accessories/extras you see on Amazon are not compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L.

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap cage
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about buying this since I read numerous reviews about things not lining up or holes being misplaced. I think those folks might have tightened the frame before it is fully assembled, which you never do with gym equipment. You get it together, it’s all set up, and then you go back and tighten everything. It actually says that on the paper that comes with it. For the price, I love this cage, it’s not the best, but it gets the job done and I really have no complaints. Definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Nick Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Damage cage
customer_reviews.text: My cage was damage when it was delivered. One of the yellow bar was bent so I did my best to bend it back and just force it in place. Please just handle the package with more care I know it heavy so safety is first.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Good value, issues with quality
customer_reviews.text: The rack absolutely is a great value for the money. It's sturdy and will allow you to lift weights and get strong. I would give it 5 stars except there were a few issues. 1) The packaging of the rack was damaged when delivered. 2) The foot of one of the rails was bent, I had to unbent it. Someone who doesn't have an access to tools might not be able to fix it themselves. 3) Paint was scratched and chipped in few places. Some of the holes weren't cleaned up after the paint was applied at the factory. Overall, as long as you're aware of the potential issues, it's a great value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Artem

customer_reviews.title: HulkFit Adjustable Bench - Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't see a lot of reviews for the bench, so i wanted to help out others who might be considering it. The bench is nice and sturdy. I'm a big guy that moves big weight and I haven't had any issues with it. As far as durability, the seat/cushion are pretty cheaply made, BUT is decent for the price. I've had comparable benches where I paid double the money. My only complaint is the distance between seat/back rest in the flat position is too great. This should be shortened or made adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Burt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Showed up in 3 days in a single box! Assembly was incredibly easy. I put the whole thing together in 2 hours and that is because I organize everything before I start. I think anybody who has problems putting this together didn't follow instructions about placing the safety bars in before tightening everything. One of the uprights seemed not as parallel at the end when it connects to the top/bottom, but it was easy enough to slide one side in first and then use body weight or a rubber mallet to adjust to the screw holes. Super sturdy for pull ups. I'm excited. now just need to figure out if I want a weight stand or the attachable weight holders.
customer_reviews.author: UtAzBoy

customer_reviews.title: Seems Sturdy But Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: So bummed! Package came severely damaged with parts poking out. I only unpacked two posts, when I saw the damage. Severely bent and scratched posts. They weren’t individually wrapped as seen on some other review pictures. Based on the marks, I may have gotten a returned cage as it seemed like it had been previously assembled. This was enough for me to return it. Didn’t even bother checking the rest of the equipment. I don’t mind some cosmetic issues but for nearly $500, the product shouldn’t be In that bad of shape. It seems like a great sturdy rack, just wish I would have received one of the good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. It took my husband and I a total of 30 minutes to assemble. Honestly, it took more time cutting the boxes it came in to fit in our recycling can. The product is sturdy and fits together nicely. I like that you can adjust the safety bars and has a great add on for dips. Would recommend. Their instructions are 4 steps, no complicated steps, very straight forward. We did test it out with a couple of squats and a couple of bench presses. Can't wait to use it for our workouts moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Hana H

customer_reviews.title: Knowing basic mechanics helps with install!
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get here because of Covid but worth the wait. Got it set up. Key tip: DO NOT TIGHTEN ANYTHING DOWN UNTIL ITS ALL ASSEMBLED AND THE CATCH BARS ARE IN. Once that is done, tighten things down and assess that the catch bars move in and out freely as you move along. This is how you assemble it squarely. Can’t wait to start getting my gains back that I’ve slowly been losing since the Corona hit us up here in Seattle.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy, buy hulkfit accessories
customer_reviews.text: Went together quick and easy and is very sturdy, great for a tight space. 6ft 15kg technique bar (mine was a titan 6ft technique bar from Amazon, easy to find,nice bar) fits perfectly. Put your J hooks in from inside the cage to get a little more clearance. Highly recommend their weight holds too, cheap and do the job perfectly. Only 1 con: my J hooks don't have anything (felt, rubber, etc) on top to deaden the sound of the bar. I fixed this on my own though with some thin rubber from Amazon. Not enough of an issue to even remove a star, this thing is sturdy as hell.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. I am roughly 250lbs and the cage is very stable while I do pull-ups. 2. I was able to assemble it by myself. 3. The extra hardware I received was clearly marked as extra removing any worry I had assembled it incorrectly. Cons: 1. Instructions for assembly are just a single diagram and not a step by step guide but...it is still pretty easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Power Cage
customer_reviews.text: It took me less than an hour to assemble. All tools were included (two wrenches) but I used two socket wrenches. All the bolts and nuts were the same size, which made things easy and there were two extra nuts and bolts thrown in (and marked “extra” ) just in case you needed them. After tightening everything, the cage is very sturdy. We loaded up an Olympic bar and placed it on the j-hooks on the front of the cage. I shook it a few times without any real effect. It takes up a small footprint compared to the smith machine it replaced. I really like the dip bars that were included.
customer_reviews.author: John C O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great Frame for Budget Gains!
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with this purchase, price was good and shipping was decent. Box came damaged but all the parts were accounted for with no damage to the pieces themselves. It was pretty easy to put together with 2 people a drill, socket, and wrench. We weren’t too keen on the yellow color but that’s just preference, we just slapped some blue paint on it and now she’s a real beaut and very sturdy. All and all we are very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Apryl_RN

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a month ago and the box came all damaged. It appeared that this opened prior and possibly returned. Need to say, I didn't put this item together right away. As I was putting this item together, I realized that I'm missing a very important piece. The Adjustable handle. Without this piece, the machine will not operate and I cannot find where to receive the adjustable handle. Needless to say, I'm very disappointed in this product. I cannot use the machine that we have spent our hard earned money on and I cannot get answers to where I can find an adjustable handle. Would not recommend anyone purchase due to limited resources around this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Beydoun

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March and it arrived in June. It was such poor quality I sent it back and got a refund. Needless to say the packing was very bad and some parts were missing, they said they would send me the parts but it takes too long. I went and bought a welder and made my own out of and old rack I had and pullies of off amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Semi-commercial build quality. Better than most home gyms, the alloy and gauge are not quite commercial grade. That being said, it is a superb piece of gym equipment: It is sturdy, the dimensions are perfect to do bench press, military press, squats with barbells, comfortably. We highly recommend the cable attachment to really get the ultimate bang for your buck. It’s very high quality and any comparable semi-commercial cable machine will cost you THOUSANDS, for the same exact thing. The lat pull down attachment is also worth it. Overall 5 stars. Almost commercial grade for a 1/10 of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: I was worried at first by reading all the reviews but I decided to gamble, and glad that I did, yes the product packaging was trashed, wrapped in plastic, would think that Hulkfit would display a better packaging. nuts and bolts were all over the box and thank goodness for the additional nuts and bolts. over all great purchase. glad that I bough t it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexact manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: This is really sturdy and should be a great bench except one critical flaw. I'm on my second try after returning the first and both have a permanent incline when they are in the "flat" setting. It is a real pain to return stuff of this size and now I still have to find a 3rd bench to replace the first two. A lot of time and money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Messed up after less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this attachment for almost a month now and its already giving me problems. I dont know the correct terminology for each little part, but one of the essential "gears" that are suppose to rotate as you pull are completely static. This creates extreme tension/friction when I try to pull in any direction. I could literally have little to no weight on it and it is not smooth at all and those rotating gears do not budge when they are suppose to run smoothly up and down the main bar. it's also starting to flake all over the place from the constant friction. I'm very disappointed in this attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Carolinee Solis

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install & more
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together -- I bought the POWER/SQUAT RACK, and the Bench, they were both very easy to install and SOLID. I would feel comfortable lifting 1000lb's off my HulkFit Bench and Squat Rack. Stylish. Easy. Solid. Affordable. Space Saving. Perfect. Oh and I did my research, too. It's a new company that's offering great deals for solid gear -- get it while you can for these prices people.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Randall

customer_reviews.title: Effective Power Cage
customer_reviews.text: The Hulkfit Power Cage was easy to assemble and is a must have for your home gym. It supports a great deal of weight and there are 17 holes to place the attachments to give you a great deal of versatility. (The holes are not labeled so I ordered some stickers to place next to them. That way it's easier to remember my settings for bench press, squat, military press, etc. In addition, the pull-up bar is a nice addition. The traditional pull-up hand holds have a grip, but I also added some grippy tape to the inside to give me more pull-up options. But overall, great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Morty

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Flaws, Lack of quality control
customer_reviews.text: One of the upright legs has the mounting brackets welded on crooked and will not allow the safety to slide in and out freely. The point of purchasing the cage was for the safety while lifting at home. I took apart and reassembled the unit four times but there is no combination of placement that will correct this problem. Currently the manufacturing plant is closed due to the virus and there's no way to get a replacement leg. The open-end wrenches supplied for assembly are cheap dime store versions unsuitable for use; expect busted knuckles if you use them. Otherwise, the unit is very attractive and would be suitable for the home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for the money. I was looking at other products that were much more expensive, but they had quality issues. This product is very sturdy and space efficient. With the added cable machine and other attachments, it pretty much does it all. Link to the attachments:
customer_reviews.author: Charles Todd

customer_reviews.title: A good option for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the product considering the price (one of the cheapest on Amazon at the time of purchase). Not the finest fit and finish (some rough edges inside the peg holes, etc.), but everything fit together correctly and without issue. Has a slight wobble when doing pull-ups or dips with a weight belt, but nothing too distracting. After a few weeks of use it has held up well with no noticeable bending or slumping.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and very sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching power cages and racks and this rack appeared to be the best price/quality option on the market. I have been greatly impressed with the quality and sturdiness of this cage. It feels sturdy doing pullups and dips, as well as any other workout that you need to do. I am very happy with this purchase, and I will purchase other items from Hulkfit again.
customer_reviews.author: Jman118

customer_reviews.title: Scam listing! Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product. It said it shipped and went right back to the same location it shipped from. This listing is a scam, and was Amazon’s choice when I ordered it. I already got a refund but wanted to warn others. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Good for home gym
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product. The only reason I gave it 4stars is because it came with a couple scratches, one of the bottom pieces came bent and I had to bend it back so I can assemble it, and on the pull up bars it wasn’t completely welded. The JHooks are a bit flimsy but I bought bungee cords from Walmart and wrapped them around the jhooks and now there a lot more sturdy. Other than that I love it, perfect for a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: B.esco

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: My family grew tired of driving to the gym so we decided on purchasing the hulkfit power cage as our first piece of equipment for our home gym. When it arrived, my 17 year old son put it together himself with little effort. Now that we have been using it for about a month now, we are very pleased with the quality of the material used for the construction. We will be adding the lat pull down soon.
customer_reviews.author: keri

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done and is safe
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is an acceptable and affordable alternative to big name brand power racks. Be warned!! Packaging was thrown together and bent the joints. I was able to bend them back using channel locks and monster effort! I’ve contacted customer service and they were outstanding to help out! They are aware of this reoccurring issue and planning to correct it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Power Cage
customer_reviews.text: A good Power Cage at a reasonable price (not the reseller prices). I took a few minutes to line the parts together on the floor before building it to make sure everything lined up. Tip: a couple of the long vertical bars arrived bent on the U shaped end where they connect, it was easier attaching the bent end to the top horizontal/black bars because they are thinner and so more forgiving. Also two people makes the build even easier although one person can do it.
customer_reviews.author: Youssef

customer_reviews.title: Decent low-cost option
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to increase exercise options in my home gym, and found it to be a sturdy, easy-to-assemble option. My wife and I were able to easily put it together in a reasonable amount of time. The packaging was kind of mangled, so I was nervous about the condition of the pieces inside, but other than a couple of scuffs, it was in good shape. I've only used it a couple of time so far, but don't have any complaints at this time and am pleased overall by the value.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Dawn Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and functional
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because of some of the reviews, but I'm very happy with my purchase. Mine came undamaged and complete (although the box was a mess by the time it arrived). I put it together by myself with no problems in about an hour. It has a few scuffs, but the uprights were in good shape and unbent. I also purchased the lab pull down and it works smoothly and I'm very happy I decided to add this attachment. It functions just as it should and it looks great as the centerpiece of my home gym. It's beautiful and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, PIA to assemble
customer_reviews.text: once together, it works great, very sturdy, feel very safe in it. Putting it together was a pain, the holes didn't line up well in a couple places, even while keeping all the bolts relatively loose, it required hits from a wood mallet and some pulling to get the bolts all in. Be careful not the mess up the threads. Overall great rack.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: didn't receive necessary parts to complete set-up
customer_reviews.text: Will re-review after company contacts me, but I received product with all the bolts necessary and even two extra but there were only two bolts included with all the packaging, not much good without any bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye gym fees.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is nice! Put it together in under an hour. Feels really sturdy, even on the gym mats it's resting on. The box, when delivered, is heavy, so having someone to help move it around is advised. I built it with one other person, I'd find it more challenging if I had to do it solo, but I'm sure it could be done. Had to use channel lock pliers on one section to get the screw in far enough for the bolt to go on. Over-all we are very happy with the Hulkfit Power Cage.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Holes Didn’t Line Up
customer_reviews.text: Overall nice unit; seems sturdy. J-hooks have a little slack in them, and they are a little loose and wobbly. I will likely purchase another brand of j-hook. One of the bottom bars had holes that did not line up. I had to drill new holes to get the unit together.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Parts don’t fit together, crooked when assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Big Disappointment in the packaging. Metal parts just had plastic bag sleeves around them and a small strip of bubble wrap placed in the middle of the cardboard box. Metal frame was bent since there was just a thin cardboard box protecting it. The frame when assembled is crooked. The last bolt to assemble will not fit as it needs to align through 4 holes. A lot of the yellow paint has deep gouges and I’m sure it will rust because of the bare metal. Chinese junk, sold at high dollar. I should of spent more on a US Company like Rogue.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Gipson

customer_reviews.title: Great cage. Can't wait to get the cable crossovers.
customer_reviews.text: Great cage. It arrived in time and was super easy to assemble. There were some minor paint chips from shipping but nothing noticeable unless you know where to look. The pull up bar is nice and ergonomic. Only thing I wish they included was numbering on the holes. But for the price I can't complain. I recommend getting the plate holders to go with this. Overall very happy with the cage and I plan on adding the cable crossovers and lat pulldown when I more space.
customer_reviews.author: Vert

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but lacks quality control and written assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Good: Heavy duty steel construction. Good value for a power cage with a LAT Pull-Down attachment. Bad: Quality control is lacking. Had to drill a hole through the lower steel frame in order to get one of the upright steel frame pieces secured properly. If you cannot figure out how to assemble the power cage and LAT Pull-Down from the two drawings (one for the power cage and one for the LAT Pull-Down) then shop around for another power cage that has written instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a little home gym during the coronavirus lockdown. My son and I put it together in about an hour. We just used it for pull ups (does shake slightly) and using it for squats, etc. For the price it was well worth it. We only have 225 pounds in weights and no issues with our bar on it or anything. I usually dont write many reviews but I saw some negative reviews which if you're second guessing i would say this is a good piece of equipment at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a budget rack.
customer_reviews.text: I've been squatting and benching in commercial gyms for roughly 6 years and finally decided to make the plunge on building a home gym. Finding a power/squat rack on a budget was my first step. All of the other budget squat racks under 350/400 dollars compromised in strength and sturdiness. This rack is rated for 1000lbs unlike the 450/500lbs rating of other budget racks. It's nice knowing that won't be a limiting factor/ceiling to my training in the future or for any other stronger lifters I may train with. The assembly was straight forward and had no misalignments or defects. I look forward to hitting some pr's and making some strength gains in this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash.
customer_reviews.text: This came with NO CABLES at all. None. And is missing a weight plate holder. Like what in the world?!?! I cannot even put it together-the cable crossovers- I’m fuming about this as I had placed this order before the COVID-19 pandemic, have been patient with the delay and now it arrives missing pieces?! Completely unacceptable. And my box arrived destroyed!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Young

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Strong/ Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why I gave it 4 stars out of 5, was because- anywhere you see black paint on this; it scratches easily. The yellow parts have clear coat on them, but where you see black It’s all flat black- So it scratches easily; the first time I used it AND ITS SCRATCHED Otherwise it’s extremely sturdy One thing they don’t mention that will help a lot with assembly is Tighten bolts slightly; then put weights on it- and then tighten everything a lot This will prevent it from being un-even I LEARNED THE HARD WAY
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product For The Price- Super Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered and received my Hulfit Powercage after ordering on Amazon. It arrived a few hours late via XPO, but considering the COVID-19 issues, a few hours is no big deal. I was able to move all of the pcs to my basement and assemble by myself in about 30 minutes. I was pleasantly surprised with how easy it was to assemble. The next day, I got my first workout in. This thing is very sturdy and is just want I was looking for. The pulley system was backordered so I cannot comment on that yet. Everything seems high quality and for the money, this was the best deal I have found in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Stark

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Product assembly was easy and able to do by myself. I have owned other power racks and this is the perfect size for a smaller basement. Basic, but exactly what is needed and I what I was looking for. The unit is slightly wobbly, so unsure how well it will hold up for dips and pull ups, but will try it out and update my review. I will also check the the nuts and bolts again. Overall, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MJM9

customer_reviews.title: Great cage, great price
customer_reviews.text: For the price I wasn’t sure what to expect. Cage with a lat pull down for 400ish. I have been pretty impressed with all the above. Cage is really solid. Came in 2 shipments pulley assembly one day, cage on another. Boxes were beat up but nothing damaged. The directions weren’t great, but still pretty easy to assemble. Just remember don’t tighten until the end when it’s all together. Lat pull down/row pulley not great but adequate enough for our needs. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. First off, amazon refused to refund me the price difference. I paid over $500 for this item. Days later, amazon decides to drop it to $406. The rack comes bent in all places and alignment is non-existent. Dont bother buying this crap. Spend your money somewhere else where you can buy quality products like Dicks Sporting Goods.
customer_reviews.author: John Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Bent parts
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately 2 of the yellow bars were bent so badly the bars couldn’t come close to fitting. Not sure how well it would’ve worked but I’m not recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin R.

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best value rack for entry level users who actually want/need a power rack. Assembly did require my wife to hold the post upright while I aligned bolt holes, but otherwise it was a one man job without difficulty. The boxed steel uprights are not the same size as some other companies so accessories like plate holders, other j-hooks, etc will likely always need to be purchased from Hulk Fit. I don't perceive this as a problem since they're fairly priced and good quality. I have already purchased/been using the plate holders. I suspect I will purchase the lat pull down accessory soon.
customer_reviews.author: consto5221

customer_reviews.title: Decent and Better than No Rack for Quarantine
customer_reviews.text: This review is a bit preemptive, only a week of use. I enjoy having it and appreciate the pull up bars, however, assembly was difficult. One of the bolt-holes has a metal nub imperfection that needed a lot of filing to remove so the bolt would fit through. Even completed, it wobbles side to side more than I like during dips and pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Bell

product_meta.title: HulkFit 1000-Pound Capacity Multi-Function Adjustable Power Cage with J-Hooks, Dip Bars and Other Optional Attachments
feature_bullets: Constructed with 11 gauge steel, this power cage has a 1000lb weight capacity. The 2.5in X 2.5in frame offers greater stability throughout
Power Cage also includes two steel safety bars with J-Hooks, two dip bars and BONUS J-Hooks
Free standing unit with a large walk-in space and rubber feet to ensure stability and protect flooring
Front of rack includes a multigrip pull-up bar for additional exercises and stretches. Cross bars can also be used for band & resistance training
Assembled dimensions: 81" x 44" x 47". Product weight: 165 Pounds (power cage only)
Customize with add-ons: Lat Pull Down and Cable Crossover attachments

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
